Dulu Beli Chevrolet Bell Air Rp 22,5 Juta, Kini Harganya Selangit
06 Nov 2019, 12:53 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Kontributor), Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Yogyakarta - Sebuah mobil klasik berwarna merah tua bersih menggoda mata pengunjung saat memasuki pelataran Hotel Melia Purosani Kota Yogyakarta, Selasa, 5 November 2019. Mobil itu merupakan seri Chevrolet Bel Air rilisan tahun 1953. Pemiliknya adalah pendiri sekaligus anggota komunitas pecinta mobil kustom Amerika yang berbasis di Yogyakarta, Hotrodiningrat, Sujiyanto alias Walik.
Walik menuturkan mobil Chevrolet Bell Air itu barang istimewa baginya. Di sela kesibukannya beternak dan memasok ayam ke pasar pasar tradisional di Yogya tiap hari, memandangi mobil yang baru selesai ia restorasi setelah 10 tahun itu seketika bisa melepaskan rasa lelahnya.
"Habis pulang antar ayam ke pasar, terus mandangi mobil ini seneng rasanya. Ini klangenan saya," ujar Walik ditemui Tempo, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Walik menuturkan kisah uniknya mulai mencintai mobil tua Amerika sekitar tahun 2009 silam. Saat itu ia mendapatkan informasi dari seorang kawan, jika di Pekalongan, Jawa Tengah, ada sebuah mobil tua ndongkrok tak terurus. Yakni Chevy Bel Air itu.
"Jadi mobil ini dulu sudah dibangun bodinya, mesinnya, tapi belum sempat diajak jalan karena pemiliknya tiba-tiba meninggal dunia, kemudian tak terurus," ujarnya.
Walau tak punya pengalaman berurusan dengan mobil klasik, saat itu Walik nekat berangkat dari Yogya ke Pekalongan untuk menengok Bel Air itu. Tak butuh lama bagi Walik mencintai mobil itu. Walik langsung merogoh uang Rp 22,5 juta agar bisa memboyong Chevy tua itu ke Yogya.
Jadilah mobil itu menjadi seri klasik yang ia miliki pertama dan dunianya pada aliran hot rod mulai melekat.
"Sejak itu, tahun 2009 dapat mobil ini, saya sisihkan untung dari jualan ayam untuk terus mendandani mobil ini sampai akhirnya rampung pertengahan 2019 ini," ujar Walik.
Walik mengaku tak banyak mengubah interior atau eksterior Chevy nya itu. Sebab sebagian besar komponennya masih orisinil dan berfungsi baik. Modal yang ia keluarkan pun untuk merestorasi mobil yang sudah ia jajal touring ke Yogya-Bandung ini menurutnya tak sampai menguras kantong. Karena ia membangunnya bertahap.
"Saya paling habis Rp 80 juta merestorasinya, tapi nggak berat karena saya cicil membangunnya," ujar Walik.
Walik mengaku tawaran demi tawaran untuk membeli Chevy Bel Air ini kerap datang dan ia berhasil menolaknya. "Pas baru datang dari Pekalongan saja saat itu (2009) sudah langsung ditawar orang Rp 45 juta, hehe," ujarnya.
Walik sampai saat ini pun juga bersikeras tak mau melepas Chevy Bel Airnya, yang harga bahannya saja atau masih belum direstorasi di pasaran sudah Rp 100 jutaan.
Semisal ada yang menghargai Chevy Bel Air itu tiga kali lipat dari harga pasaran bahan, baru Walik tampak terdiam.
"Rp 300 juta? Enggak dulu deh, belum butuh. Masih suka sama mobil ini," ujarnya tertawa.
Walik malah kini sudah menambah dua mobil Amerika klasik sebagai bahan klangenan barunya. Yakni Chevrolet Suburban 1953 dan GMC pickup 1950.
Mobil Chevrolet Bel Air 1953 milik Walik juga bakal mejeng dalam ajang Hot Rod Weekend Party yang digelar komunitas Hotrodiningrat pada 9-10 November 2019 mendatang di lokasi di Parkir Barat Hotel Melia Purosani Kota Yogyakarta.
text:
Previously Buy a Chevrolet Bell Air Rp. 22.5 Million, Now the Price is exorbitant
06 Nov 2019, 12:53 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Contributor), Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Yogyakarta - A classic dark red car cleanly tempts the eyes of visitors as they enter the courtyard of the Melia Purosani City Hotel, Yogyakarta, Tuesday, November 5, 2019. The car is the Chevrolet Bel Air series released in 1953. The owner is the founder and a member of the car-loving community American custom based in Yogyakarta, Hotrodiningrat, Sujiyanto alias Walik.
Walik said that the Chevrolet Bell Air was a special item for him. In between his busy raising livestock and supplying chickens to traditional markets in Yogya every day, watching the car that he had just finished restoration after 10 years could immediately release his fatigue.
"After returning home from the chicken to the market, continue to watch the car like it feels. This is my Klangenan," said Walik when met by Tempo, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Walik tells his unique story began to love the old American car around 2009 ago. At that time he got information from a friend, if in Pekalongan, Central Java, there was an old car without any maintenance. Namely the Chevy Bel Air.
"So this car used to have built its body, engine, but had not been invited to walk because the owner suddenly died, then neglected," he said.
Although he had no experience dealing with classic cars, Walik was determined to leave from Yogya to Pekalongan to see Bel Air. It didn't take long for Walik to love the car. Walik immediately reached Rp 22.5 million to bring the old Chevy to Yogya.
Be the car became a classic series that he had first and his world on the hot rod flow began to stick.
"Since then, in 2009 I got this car, I set aside profits from selling chickens to continue to dress this car until it is finally completed in the middle of 2019," Walik said.
Walik claimed not to change the interior or exterior of the Chevy. Because most of the components are still original and function well. He also spent the capital to restore the car that he had tried touring to Yogyakarta-Bandung, according to him, not to drain the bag. Because he built it gradually.
"I spent the most Rp. 80 million to restore it, but it was not difficult because I paid in installments to build it," said Walik.
Walik claimed to offer after bid to buy a Chevy Bel Air often came and he successfully refused. "When I just arrived from Pekalongan, at that time (2009), people were already offered Rp. 45 million, hehe," he said.
Even though the Walik insists that they don't want to release the Chevy Bel Air, the price of the material alone or that has not been restored in the market has reached Rp. 100 million.
If someone appreciates the Chevy Bel Air three times the market price of the material, then Walik seems speechless.
"Rp. 300 million? Not yet, don't need it. Still like this car," he laughed.
Walik has now even added two classic American cars as new Klangenan material. Namely the 1953 Chevrolet Suburban and 1950 GMC pickup.
Walik's 1953 Chevrolet Bel Air car will also show in the Hot Rod Weekend Party event held by the Hotrodiningrat community on 9-10 November 2019 at the location in the West Parking of Melia Purosani Hotel, Yogyakarta City.
